channel.title: briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Bureau of Labor Statistics postpones key data report with no explanation
item.description: The Bureau of Labor Statistics on Friday postponed the release of a key annual report central to future inflation data. Why it matters : The BLS — cha...

item.title: Harris book ignites tensions with potential 2028 presidential rivals
item.description: In her forthcoming memoir, Harris recounts the presidential campaign she ran, offering at times blunt observations of top Democrats she could face as ...

item.title: Trump unveils $100K yearly fee on H-1B visas in clampdown on legal immigration
item.description: The Trump administration also plans to launch a $1 million “gold card” visa for wealthy foreigners in a dramatic overhaul of the nation’s paths to leg...

item.title: Alexander Acosta testifies on Epstein case behind closed doors

item.title: Trump administration asks Supreme Court to let it end protected status for Venezuelans
item.description: The Trump administration asked the Supreme Court to pause a judge’s order saying that the administration improperly stripped temporary protections for...

item.title: Trump told to refile New York Times lawsuit judge dismissed as too wordy
item.description: A federal judge struck President Trump's $15 billion lawsuit against the New York Times Friday after deeming the original complaint was "decidedly imp...

item.title: Rand Paul's last-minute demands push key cybersecurity law to the brink
item.description: A key cybersecurity law with broad bipartisan backing is in danger of expiring because of last-minute demands from Sen. Rand Paul (R-Ky.), who seems r...

item.title: Trump suggests China approves TikTok deal, though app's fate still unclear
item.description: President Trump and Chinese leader Xi Jinping spoke about a TikTok deal Friday, but details on the social media platform's U.S. future remain unclear....

item.title: Johnson hands out pinkie promises before House vote on shutdown
item.description: Speaker Mike Johnson was seen making House floor pinkie promises Friday ahead of the vote on a short-term spending stopgap, which passed 217-212. Why ...

item.title: New poll reveals warning signs for Trump with Latino voters
item.description: A survey from the liberal-leaning group Somos Votantes shows Latino voters are souring on the president.

item.title: Trump is selling a strong economy. Voters aren’t buying it.
item.description: Privately, aides concede voters remain uneasy about prices but argue their policies are beginning to turn things around.

item.title: Former Trump statistics chief slams Friday firing of Erika McEntarfer
item.description: Bill Beach said the president's suggestions that the jobs report was rigged betrayed a misunderstanding in how those numbers are assembled.

item.title: Trump fires statistics chief after soft jobs report
item.description: The monthly jobs report showed just 73,000 jobs in July, with big reductions to May's and June's numbers

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
